name: Six Feet Under Dip
author: *mis
summary: I made this a couple of weeks ago for a Halloween party and it was a pretty big hit! It's also pretty versatile as far as ingredients, as long as you put the green onions on top to mimic grass on a grave. You can use low-fat or reduced-sodium ingredients and it is still 'to die for!'
ingredients: 1 (8 inch) flour tortilla, cut into strips resembling 'tombstones'
1 tablespoon melted butter, or as needed
1 pinch chili powder, or as needed
2 (15 ounce) cans black beans, drained and rinsed
directions: Preheat oven to 450 degrees F (230 degrees C)
Heat vegetable oil in a large skillet over medium heat; cook and stir onion in the hot oil until softened and slightly browned, 5 to 10 minutes
Cook and stir until beef is crumbly, evenly browned, and no longer pink, about 10 minutes
Drain and discard any excess grease
Stir in water and simmer until beef mixture has thickened, about 10 minutes
Remove from heat and cool slightly
Arrange the cut tortillas on a shallow baking sheet
Toast tortilla in the preheated oven until stiff enough to stand up as 'tombstones' in the dip, about 5 minutes per side
Brush toasted tortilla with melted butter and sprinkle with chili powder
Spread refried beans into the bottom of a 9x13-inch baking dish
Mix sour cream and salsa together in a small bowl; spread over refried beans
Sprinkle ground beef mixture atop salsa-sour cream layer
Top with a black bean layer; spread Cheddar cheese into a layer
Add green onions and cilantro as the top 'grass' layer
